title: Langdale Forest Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Mick Garratt / Forest Track, Langdale Forest
images.caption: Forest Track, Langdale Forest

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Cyclists in Langdale Forest
images.caption: Cyclists in the forest. Cycling is very popular on the roads in Langdale Forest, and is actively encouraged by the Forestry Commission.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Clear Felling, Langdale Forest
images.caption: Clear Felling. Blakey Topping in the distance.

description: This large forest in the North Yorks Moors has mountain bike trails and walking routes to try. The coniferous forest has a number of pretty streams and lots of wildlife to look out for. Keep your eyes peeled for nightjar, bullfinch, adders, lizards and the pearl bordered fritillary butterflies. The Blue Man Walk passes through the forest so you can pick this up to extend your walk. You can follow the trail through the North York Moors to Dalby Forest and Broxa Forest . Also nearby is the expansive Wykeham Forest and the fascinating sandstone sculptures at Bridestones Nature Reserve . Harwood Dale Forest lies just to the east of the forest and has nearly 2000 acres of woodland trails to try. The pretty village and beck are also well worth exploring.
